intro: Aira effusa, commonly known as slender grass or common aira, is a perennial grass species native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It thrives in a variety of habitats, including meadows, roadsides, and disturbed soils. Botanically, it is characterized by its fibrous root system and its ability to spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
